要學, 緊係學React啦(syntax同Vanilla JS極度接近, 正!), 唔好滾攪Angular喇!

JS 根本係一個好亂既ecosystem
太多transpiler 太多framework
當你學完一個framework，人地己經轉晒用第二個framework

JS 根本係一個好亂既ecosystem
太多transpiler 太多framework
當你學完一個framework，人地己經轉晒用第二個framework


我採用JS transpilers/frameworks既大原則係: 四大(Google/Apple/Microsoft/Facebook)出品既要認真學習長用; 其他出品既要睇下個user community growth trend, grow到咁上下大先會考慮長用; 其餘既會睇project既個別要求而定!

而家啲framework/library出得快過你去認識一個framework/library, 全不受控, 好應該搵/成立一個權威組織監管下!

js有樣on9野想屌好耐lang
object唔洗define attr先，可以寫寫下係唔知邊到object.attr1 = sth ，屌佢老尾點睇呀，連某d library都會咁寫


你指object literal? 係咪好似咁:
var foo = {}; // create an object literal

foo.bar = "Hello World";

console.log(foo.bar); // Hello World
console.log(foo.hasOwnProperty("bar")); // true

var fooclone = Object.create(foo);
console.log(fooclone.bar); // Hello World
fooclone.bar = "Hello Universe"; // cloned property "bar" from foo is now replaced with a new value in fooclone
console.log(fooclone.bar); // Hello Universe

var fooclone2 = Object.create(foo);
console.log(fooclone2.bar); // Hello World
var fooclone3 = Object.create(fooclone);
console.log(fooclone3.bar); // Hello Universe

var fooclone4 = Object.create(foo);
fooclone4.chart = "Fuck World";
console.log(foo.chart); // Undefined
console.log(fooclone.chart); // Undefined
console.log(fooclone2.chart); // Undefined
console.log(fooclone3.chart); // Undefined
console.log(fooclone4.chart); // Fuck World

Object literal係咁架喎, 而且an object can clone the properties (and methods) of other objects, 任clone唔嬲, 幾方便呀!

JS係行Prototypal Inheritance, 乜L都object玩晒, 唔同Java/C#果啲Classical Inheritance, 又class又object又interface又constructor! 總之JS係簡單好多!

js有樣on9野想屌好耐lang
object唔洗define attr先，可以寫寫下係唔知邊到object.attr1 = sth ，屌佢老尾點睇呀，連某d library都會咁寫


你指object literal? 係咪好似咁:
var foo = {}; // create an object literal

http://foo.bar = "Hello World";

console.log(http://foo.bar); // Hello World
console.log(foo.hasOwnProperty("bar")); // true

var fooclone = Object.create(foo);
console.log(http://fooclone.bar); // Hello World
http://fooclone.bar = "Hello Universe"; // cloned property "bar" from foo is now replaced with a new value in fooclone
console.log(http://fooclone.bar); // Hello Universe

var fooclone2 = Object.create(foo);
console.log(http://fooclone2.bar); // Hello World
var fooclone3 = Object.create(fooclone);
console.log(http://fooclone3.bar); // Hello Universe

var fooclone4 = Object.create(foo);
fooclone4.chart = "Fuck World";
console.log(foo.chart); // Undefined
console.log(fooclone.chart); // Undefined
console.log(fooclone2.chart); // Undefined
console.log(fooclone3.chart); // Undefined
console.log(fooclone4.chart); // Fuck World

Object literal係咁架喎, 而且an object can clone the properties (and methods) of other objects, 任clone唔嬲, 幾方便呀!

JS係行Prototypal Inheritance, 乜L都object玩晒, 唔同Java/C#果啲Classical Inheritance, 又class又object又interface又constructor! 總之JS係簡單好多!

不過如果用typescript 就可以做到strong type 行compiler 就知有問題

呢篇睇過, 係道出咗Front-End用React要面對既各種挑戰, 識既會覺得so compelling, 唔識既會感到so confusing!

下面呢篇就對大家一窩蜂咁用React提出咗一啲見解, 唔錯的!
https://hackernoon.com/you-might-not-need-react-e5fd54611111#.4lk57uyhn

Our common mistake is loving these new technologies. As we hear a new beautiful word with “JS” at the end and read its small marketing description, we’re ready to start writing new projects with this “brilliant” thing. But the truth is that the marketing bullshit and the beautiful name are the only advantages of this new thing, and it could be forgotten in next two months. We spend so much time on learning new things just to forget about them and ruin all the knowledge we have when once again someone on the Internet says that it’s not cool anymore and there is this newest thing that is really great.

New technologies always sound good for software developers. Yet instant migration to them does not often end successfully. This problem is not about front-end only but it’s very relevant to front-end, because now is the time when we have too many new things appearing every day here.

We have to see why we refuse to work with some old technology and why we can’t use it anymore. We need to filter new technologies, find diamonds and stay away from garbage. We have to carefully pick the moment of the migration. Sometimes we don’t even need it despite all the appeal of this idea. Sometimes we need to wait for a long time to proceed it. And only sometimes we can do it on the spot.

You can create a hybrid app with Ionic framework using Ionic Creator!
You can view a hybrid app developed by Ionic framework using Ionic View!
Ionic 1 is for Angular, Ionic 2 is for Angular 2, 好似係!

Angular/Angular 2 with Ionic framework只能用嚟develop hybrid apps, 不如轉投React Native出cross-platform native apps好過啦:
